greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n if A103689(n)*n +/- 1 are twin primes; a(n) = 0 otherwise.
example: For n=5 2*5-1=9 is not prime, 2*5+1=11 is prime so a(5)=0.
For n=6 1*6-1=5 is prime, 1*6+1=7 is prime, 5 and 7 are twin primes so a(6)=6.
mathematica: lktp[n_]:=Module[{k=1},While[NoneTrue[k*n+{1,-1},PrimeQ],k++];If[AllTrue[k*n+{1,-1},PrimeQ],n,0]]; Array[lktp,100] (* The program uses the functions NoneTrue and AllTrue from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 09 2014 *)
results.author: _Pierre CAMI_, Feb 12 2005
